topic.title: Announcing 1+Gallery, an updated ZeroGallery Merger
topic.body:
Zite at: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1PGaLLNiadMzrmw6MMMnpZnskwFcdgZoS4/
Git Center: http://127.0.0.1:43110/191JBSmjUStVdF6zxqujN2MZUk1KaphEPe

You will need to add some ZeroGallery Hubs for any content to show up in the gallery.

I will be posting the source code on Git Center soon. Would love to offer my improvements to Sorasumi Sayo, but I haven't seen any recent activity on any of his projects.

Is there a feature you'd like to see in the next version of 1+Gallery? Be sure to let me know!
If you want to contribute but don't know how, you could start a new hub with your favorite manga, comics, paintings, photos, etc.

# Known Problems
* No Chinese translation for new strings
* Browser back button does not work as it's supposed to (original 0-gallery had this problem as well)
* Fullscreen focus doesn't work on all browsers
* UI may not work on small screens

# Roadmap
* Fix known problems (duh!), ~~the List Limit should be fixed tomorrow-ish~~. As for the others, I have no idea.
* Gallery size in GalleryList mode (easy, but hard to do efficiently)
* Beautify tags by moving often occuring namespaces such as author, artist, photographer, etc. from tags to the metadata listing for a clearer overview
* Gallery editing (this is a rather big one, but this should be added to the hubs, not the merger)
* Tag proposal by viewers which hub owner can then approve or block
* Show pinned status in GalleryList mode (easy)
* Slideshow mode with custom timer
* Visual feedback on preload gallery button
* Press space to go to next page

# Changelogs

## Update 1+.0.4
* Added button to settings to show new R-18 content in feed
* Support excluding tags in search query (eg. `!:tentacles`)
* Add Chapter support, won't do much until new hub code is developed
* Colored query examples on filter tab for clarity
* Made "Back to Title" and "Enter Fullscreen Mode" use the general button style
* Lowered min-width of the zite and changed some css so that it scales to smaller screens
* Listview will now switch to 1 column on small sizes

## Update 1+.0.3
* "Preload All" button know has visual feedback
* Image view is more compact (Back to tile, nav and fullscreen are on a single line)
* Hub tab added with a list for ~SFW hubs, **send me your hub link if you want it added!**
* Some tags now appear in the metadata list as well as in the tag list, the metadata also has two columns now to keep things compact.

## Update 1+.0.2
* "Preload All" button, as requested by Thunder
* Added some spacing in various places to make the screen look less cluttered
* Theme consistency for interactibles
* Made the tabs look like tabs, rather than disjointed buttons
* Some behind-the-screens work on making the site easy to customize (CSS variables for colors), which will allow for day/night theme (why anyone would use day is a mystery to me) and other such nonsense.
* Fixed an error where hyperlinks would return 404
* Fixed an error where the last page would not be preloaded

## Update 1+.0.1
* Images now scale up to fill screen (keeping ratio)
* fixed some english text
* tags for crawlers
* R-18 listing now works as it should (more or less) reload page after changing this setting
* some graphical design changes to make the zite more in line with its zeronet neighbors

## Initial release: 1+.0

### Added QoL Improvements
* Fullscreen view-mode
 * Click right half of page for next
 * Click left half of page for back
 * Click outside or on text to exit
* Preloading the next page (only forwards)
* Indicator for preload status (hides when not hovered)
* GalleryList limit setting (default 100)
* GalleryDetail picture status indicator and have/total metadata
* Tags are now sorted by namespace -> name

### UI Improvements
* Tag listing looks better now
* Removed top margin on page

topic.title: GalleryHub+ Demo
topic.body:
Visit: http://127.0.0.1:43110/14NFfVBBAFbNdqX4nyGjyBF1BRSz7jn2QP/
Git Center: http://127.0.0.1:43110/114AZoCSLsZu6Ktfnfu64Uoh8pcdVYFhSX

# Upgrading to the Christmas '18 Edition
With the new fragmented content.json layout I'm not entirely certain what the best way to upgrade is. It might be best to manually transition your main `/content.json` to include `/galleries/content.json` (but don't forget to set `"includes_allowed": true`) and only clean the files+optional lists and adjust the `ignore` after that. Basically unless you know what you're doing, I recommend cloning a new gallery. The UI isn't as fancy as it should be and some hub owner documentation will be added soon to help newbs out.

## Short introduction to using the new system
There's three types of signing:
* Sign & Publish the site (the main `/content.json`)
* Sign & Publish the gallerylist (`/galleries/content.json`)
* Sign & Publish a gallery (`/galleries/path-to-gallery/content.json`)

A gallery should be signed to publish any changes to it, whether those are metadata changes, chapter or image/thumbnail changes. There is a useful button to sign all galleries marked as unsigned. If you manually changed the json, or for any other reason which to sign, just click the "Save" button, this will mark the gallery for signing.

The list should be signed and published whenever a new gallery is added. There's currently no way to remove or move galleries from the UI, but once this is added these actions would also require signing the list.

The site itself should be signed and published only after upgrading the code, or changes to the css, etc. You should probably know whether you need to do this if you need to do this. And if you don't know whether you need to do this, you probably don't need to.

# Updates
* Content now split into smaller files per gallery
* Can now add chapters
* Can now create new galleries
* Can now add images to existing galleries (only at the back, prepend doesn't work yet!)

# Features
* Refer visitors to 1+Gallery on the front page
* Show a list of the galleries
* A gallery editor where you can edit the title, description, type, language and tags (need to be owner, otherwise refers you to appropriate 1+Gallery page)
* Cloneable already if you want to try it out!

# Roadmap
* ~~Add an upload wizard. I recommend using a script instead because it will be faster and less likely to fail, but no hub would be complete without the option of uploading straight from the zite.~~
* Setting default language, type, rating
* ~~Adding images.~~ Need to add a cover to the front? ~~Or a new chapter to the back?~~
* ~~Define chapters in a multi-chapter gallery. Select an image and fill in the title.~~
* Computer-suggested tags. Let the computer guess what tags you may want to add.
* User-suggested tags. People can leave tag suggestions on galleries, the owner just has to click accept or reject.

# How to use on an existing gallery
1. Back up. No guarantees this won't mess up your manifest.json's
2. Clone GalleryHub+
3. Move/delete your hubs content.json, index.html, lanczos_worker.min.js, main.css, main.js and the css folder.
4. Copy/move your new clone's content (except for galleries) to your old hub.
5. Cross your fingers this doesn't mess up.

topic.title: Lost optional files
topic.body: Optional files from one of my own sites seem to have gone missing. I noticed this a while after my drive ran out of space, so I'm thinking Zeronet may have cleaned up optional files from my own site to create space. Is this possible? Would 'help distribute all files' on my own site stop this if that is indeed the case?

topic.title: Malicious code found in NPM package event-stream dependency
topic.body:
# Malicious code found in npm package `event-stream` downloaded 8 million times in the past 2.5 months
A widely used npm package, `event-stream`, has been found to contain a malicious package named `flatmap-stream.` This was disclosed via a GitHub issue raised against the source repo.

The event-stream package makes creating and working with streams easy, and is very popular, getting roughly 2 million downloads a week. The malicious child package has been downloaded nearly 8 million times since its inclusion back in September 2018.

We have added the malicious package to our vulnerability database. If your project is being monitored by Snyk and we find the malicious dependency (either `event-stream@3.3.6` or any version of `flatmap-stream`) you will be notified via Snyk’s routine alerts.

If your projects are not monitored by Snyk and you’d like to test them for the use of this package, click here to test your repositories with Snyk, or use our CLI to test projects locally.

##Read more:
EXTERNAL LINK: https://snyk.io/blog/malicious-code-found-in-npm-package-event-stream

topic.title: 1+Gallery and GalleryHubPlus updated, pushed to Git Center
topic.body:
Posting this here as well in the hopes that hub owners take notice and update (if they choose to).
[1+Gallery](/1PGaLLNiadMzrmw6MMMnpZnskwFcdgZoS4) is an image gallery viewer, forked from 0-gallery in late 2018.

In these recent updates I've fulfilled some long-standing requests by hub owners, namely:
- A compact gallery list
- Faster list loading speeds
- Custom landing page for hub

There's also some features for end-users:
- Add hub prompt when requested url contains a hub that has not been downloaded
- Add sign-in prompt when liking gallery when signed out
- Button to select a hub to search (does not support including/excluding, yet)
- Scroll to top when changing list page (as well as fixing the page buttons which were sometimes a bit wonky)
- Cleaned up the tags section a little (mainly useful for manga)

This means that [this link to Ubunchu (en)](/1PGaLLNiadMzrmw6MMMnpZnskwFcdgZoS4/?!/g/14NFfVBBAFbNdqX4nyGjyBF1BRSz7jn2QP/ubunchu-en) should work even for people who haven't downloaded the GalleryHubPlus Demo zite!

1542671496_1GDcCK6cWoj98mg541Yj9rW1nwXcB.body:
> [moor](#comment_62_17zoTjVZEBUdo6uAvQvtbih7ibBMHQRsrH): Fullscreen mode "crops" the image if the image is bigger than the screen resolution.

I presume you're probably using it on a mobile device, try flipping it. I think I know a way to solve the problem using just css, if it works an update should be out in a couple of days.

> [moor](#comment_63_17zoTjVZEBUdo6uAvQvtbih7ibBMHQRsrH): i'm on a desktop in a secondary monitor which has a low resolution support.

could you try again after the update comes through? I just signed it.
* fullscreen mode should now scale images better on small screens (I hope)
* fixed some English strings
* added search tags for crawlers
* R-18 listing should be fixed, you may need to reload when changing the settings between show/hide

> [moor](#comment_64_17zoTjVZEBUdo6uAvQvtbih7ibBMHQRsrH): yup, now i can see the full image, just three things:1) small images don't scale2) images are anchored to 'Top' (i.e they snap from the top instead of say, center)3) images have a padding of some pixels, i.e they don't occupy all horizontal space available. [...]

(2) has already been fixed, just not published. Not sure how I should handle (1)
I think you mean margins instead of padding in (3), which is strange -- it shouldn't have any.

> [moor](#comment_65_17zoTjVZEBUdo6uAvQvtbih7ibBMHQRsrH): probably, idk web design lingo :D, but still, images don't occupy all the available horizontal space. [...]

I don't know web design lingo either, just learning as I go along.

I've signed a new version that also scales images up (I'm not sure this is an improvement because quality can only go down when scaling up, but let's give it a try). This does introduce a drawback, clicking outside of the image above or below will no longer exit. I could write a fix in js, don't think css can solve this, but I'm tired and it seems a lot of work. I'll probably just rewrite the help text to reflect this. Clicking the text to exit still works as it should, so there's no risk of getting stuck in fullscreen.

Update 1+.0.2 has been signed. See changelog in OP.

> [thunder33345](#comment_331_1AHEQxyRG9s6owyJHShB4U4rg9GL5FMX5K): Hit me up with these strings file, ill try my best to translate when I am free [...]

Thank you for the offer! I've added the feature you've suggested and will send you the English strings on ZeroMail.

> [moor](#comment_67_17zoTjVZEBUdo6uAvQvtbih7ibBMHQRsrH): preload works fine but there is no visual feedback (except for the zeronet loading bar on the top) clicking the button "feels" like it has no immediate effect. (sorry if i'm saying what you already know :D)
 
I noticed that too, thought about it for a second and then sighed "I'm too lazy to fix that." But I'll write it down for when I'm in a less lazy mood. The easiest solution would be to fade the button after it has been clicked. If the user reloads the page the button would be normal again if not every image has been downloaded yet, but I don't really think there's a way to track progress across reloads. I could save it locally, but the pictures might get cleaned up and the user may want to use the preload all button again. So I'd just stick to some visual feedback for that session.

Update 1+.0.3 signed, see OP for changelog. Moor should be happy :-)

Does anyone know if the sourcecode for the ZeroGallery hubs is available online somewhere? I'd love to improve the life of hubowners so that there will be more of them! If you've made a hub, be sure to let me know, I'll be adding a list of ~SFW hubs to a new zite tab to help new users find content.

> [pexo](#comment_28_1DfrA2M9Qra6stqT6tzwNMYNweswY54KAC): I've also searched for that, but haven't really found anything. Let me know If you come across it.I also done some research on how the gallery hub content collection works, so if you need help with that, feel free to ask me. [...]

If it doesn't turn up, I might end up writing my own Hub zite for people to clone. Transitioning from the old hubs to the new should then simply be a question of replacing all files except the galleries folder.
I have a list of NSFW hubs, but I'm hesitant about adding those to 1+Gallery, I would prefer parents felt OK letting their children browse galleries on 1+Gallery.
No, the sourcecode hasn't been published yet, but I will put it on Git Center. I really should get to it because I have no backups atm.

> [nekololi](#comment_308_1FzZsDQdh8wk71bDLxURPzmAt2FXehoNAB): this is a minor thing, but 0gallery has a setting which allows you to be notified in ZeroHello of any new non-r18 gallery that gets published. i would like to be able to be notified of any new r-18 galleries too.

That should be easy to implement. Of course non-R18 only should not be replaced.

Update 1+.0.4 signed.

Added some suggestions by nekololi, also added Moor's gallery to the list.
Also: we on Git Center now! Yeehaw!

> [pexo](#comment_29_1DfrA2M9Qra6stqT6tzwNMYNweswY54KAC): Nice!Some ideas I had for 0gallery some time ago: [...]

I'll take some time to respond to your points:

1) "Default" tags. Planned.
2) See git center page for more details on how I plan to implement user-tags
3) Tag descriptions is a really good idea. This should be added.
4) Currently: Manga, Comic, Doujinshi, Collection. CG should probably be added as a category.
5) Not a bad idea, I will think about it.
6) Public hubs. This is planned. But a lot of work, so not any time soon. Will not be compatible with 0-gallery, only 1+.
7) Voting, rating, favoriting are all Planned.
8) Sort of planned ... although I have no idea about how to do this.
9) Not a priority, but would be neat.

> [moor](#comment_78_17zoTjVZEBUdo6uAvQvtbih7ibBMHQRsrH): hey guys help!!! i uploaded a new gallery just for testing and delete it afterwards (its folder and entry on content.json), published the changes but yet i can still see it on both 0-gallery and 1+gallery, and it keeps asking for the old jpg i've uploaded. i'm using GalleryHub+.

you should probably rebuild the database on 1+Gallery (not on your hub!).
1. Drag the ZeroNet icon in the top right to the left.
2. Scroll down to Database
3. Click "Rebuild"

1542861175_1PkVAeJswTgCVG4MN6BZG7YdWpzgm.body: yup, used to be on there

> [scotcyguy2](#comment_2_16aoHyKbwpvBmgCtNqX1tW9N5bvXGmd1oX): Yea I agree decentralised is the way forward...but I think it's going to take a while before it takes off, I've noticed it seems fairly light on users round here.  I tried steemit, but it sucks balls.

To attract more users we'll need more content. ZeroNet offers a great userexperience: the UI is sexy, the interactions are satisfyingly swift (because they happen locally), the big zites look friendly and orderly. But what are they going to do here? [Play](http://127.0.0.1:431110/1PLAYgDQboKojowD3kwdb3CtWmWaokXvfp/) is great, but their torrents often lack seeders, [1+Gallery](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1PGaLLNiadMzrmw6MMMnpZnskwFcdgZoS4/) is great (shameful plug, I know, but check it out if you haven't!) as long as you're only looking for hentai (or a couple of big mangas)...  [KopyKate](http://127.0.0.1:43110/big.kopykate.bit/) is great, but there's not a lot on it (some good documentaries though, forgot who uploaded them), [KxoVid](http://127.0.0.1:43110/14c5LUN73J7KKMznp9LvZWkxpZFWgE1sDz/?/) has a lot of potential, sadly it could do with some UI work (e.g. show thumbnails) and has near to no content.

I'd say ZeroNet has the coders, but not enough content providers. And we'll need those to attract more users. I think one of the best ways to convince users is also the ease with which one can start a blog! It's even easier than using a blogging service on the clearnet! That's a heck of a good way to convince people to use it ... except they won't have much of an audience...

1542060084_12c3mbFn8EzBa5Tw3WnZ12azK99Ys.body:
> [npc4921](#comment_6_1PkVAeJswTgCVG4MN6BZG7YdWpzgmek5WZ): Sorry about the quad post there.

you can delete posts, hover left of your text and click to edit then a button at the bottom should appear to delete a post

1542892944_1HiF6gUThBQQqghUPLxc7h2uupMJx.body: The key is stored in sites.json, I believe. To edit you need to enable "__This is my site__" as Styromaniac said.

1542927247_1BfEZv3vAsVPvUg758JmJfRN6dsm7.body:
Hi new, nice to meet you :-p

Important Zites: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1MiS3ud9JogSQpd1QVmM6ETHRmk5RgJn6E/ is a good place to start, easy to find things on. For discussions ZeroTalk and ZeroMe are the most active, but ZeroVoat and Millchan are also pretty good . For content I personally recommend Play(+), KopyKate, KxoVid, 1+Gallery (I may be a bit biased on that one) and ZeroLSTN (has a bit of a bug uploading lately).

1543026395_1GDcCK6cWoj98mg541Yj9rW1nwXcB.body:
> [moor](#comment_70_17zoTjVZEBUdo6uAvQvtbih7ibBMHQRsrH): Just one thing, i can still see my gallery from a merger however i can only see the gallery list but not the gallery on mine own hub, just the settings, is this behavior correct? i can see your gallery on your hub.

I'll look into it.

Update: removed a feature that wasn't finished that may have caused it. (published and unpublished galleries) update your clone and see if it's fixed.
Another problem could be if there's any non-folder files in the galleries folder for some reason.

> [moor](#comment_71_17zoTjVZEBUdo6uAvQvtbih7ibBMHQRsrH): everything looks normal, but i think we may have misunderstood each other, i will describe better:1) I open my galleryhub2) I click on a gallery.3) it redirects to a config page with two tabs,  'Metadata' and 'Add Files', 'Metadata' has some options (btw, nice that we can now edit easily some options) and just that. [...]

In that case: Yes, that is normal. If `owner==true` then you go to the edit screen, if `owner==false` you go to the gallery view. The edit screen will show the images as well in the future, I just haven't gotten to it yet.

I've signed an update to my demonstration hub.

* Thumbnails visible in editor with page numbers (starting with 0)
* Chapters. All images in a gallery are put into one chapter by default, but if your gallery should be divided into multiple you can click an image to start a new chapter from that image onwards. You can, of course, change the title (for now it says 'test' by default, should probably be 'New Chapter' or something like that). To save you need to scroll back up and click 'Save' or 'Save and Back'. These buttons will be duplicated below in the future so you don't have to scroll back up. 1+Gallery supports chapters already, but it does not yet show an index, just the chapter titles in viewing mode.
I've signed my hub with the latest updates: you can now create galleries and add images to existing galleries, let me now if I missed something

> want to return back to index of his halleries
There currently is no way back (MUHAHAHA, you can't escape the merger zite), but visitors probably shouldn't be using the hub anyway and rather the merger filtering by hub. I'll be adding a dropdown selector to filter by hub to the merger at some point.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_504_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): Regarding filtering of the galleries on the GalleryHub+ [...]

I will probably not be changing the filtering much -- certainly no complete overhaul, feel free to propose or even implement a new filtering system on the merger git, but it's not a priority in my opinion. The filtering system works and is explained on the zite. The only thing it's really missing is `OR`, and that's not all that important because generally you want to refine using AND, or if you really want to widen you search you can just search multiple times with different words/tags.

I've made a git issue for your 3rd point, because I really like it.

> [moor](#comment_76_17zoTjVZEBUdo6uAvQvtbih7ibBMHQRsrH): main.js needs to be published.

Are you sure? Other people seem able to download/use the zite fine, I've tried from another pc successfully as well. It's possible the new version hadn't crossed over from Tor to clearnet yet, or you were just unlucky with the updating connections.

> [nekololi](#comment_314_1FzZsDQdh8wk71bDLxURPzmAt2FXehoNAB): [...] i've deployed a site with some (non-h) manga here. [...]
I'll add it to the hub list.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_510_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): @1pgallery i see some errors on 1+Gallery, did i uploaded at a wrong time?

The problem is that you uploaded a gallery to my hub, instead of cloning the hub and uploading to your hub after that. The instructions aren't very clear there, ~~I will fix that soon~~ FIXED!. I'm thinking of making a public hub that anyone can upload to using their zeroid/kxoid/etc. but that will take a while.

You haven't heard much from me lately, but I've been busy. Read the OP to see what's new. It's still a bit rough around the edges, and **could break your hub**. I recommend cloning a new hub if you want to try it out.

**TL;DR** content.json split into many files, decrease sign & publish times for big hubs!

Just pushed a UI update. Signing & Publishing now presents the user with animated feedback. This will be extended to saving data soon. There's also some informational text on the homepage for hub owners as to how they should manage their galleries using the new GalleryHub+. Upgrading within the new system is completely safe.

The problem with upgrading from older versions is that signing the upgrade will cause all seeders to delete their files, then redownload them, I don't think there's any way around this. Your files should be perfectly safe though.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_536_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): @1pgalleryOn 14NFfVBBAFbNdqX4nyGjyBF1BRSz7jn2QP, the page title is: "1+Gallery | ..."and page description is: "This is a ZeroGallery hub, you should use a ZeroGallery merger such as 1+Gallery." [...]

Good point, I'll change that soon!

> [schiz0](#comment_34_153dW34Ng5fVUZ5D5NcZRfAbvRQS1jYC1k): I've tried to clone some galleryhubs but always, when I try to upload images, it stops on generating thumbs

I can't keep track on which zite is running what version of GalleryHub+, but the Demo hub is always the most up-to-date (or at least will be as long as I'm the only active dev), so you should always clone/update from that one. I will try cloning it myself and uploading some galleries to see if I broke anything.

EDIT: Just tested it and it worked fine for me, so I can't figure out what's happening from my end. What browser are you using? Does JS spout any errors in the console log?

> [schiz0](#comment_35_153dW34Ng5fVUZ5D5NcZRfAbvRQS1jYC1k): I'm using Beaker;I've tried Firefox and it works! [...]

Hmmm, I'll have to try out Beaker then. I only tested it with the Tor Browser (family of Firefox).

> [schiz0](#comment_37_153dW34Ng5fVUZ5D5NcZRfAbvRQS1jYC1k): It could be nicethe option to insert image's caption

Currently there's no way to delete images from the GUI, delete image manually and remove entries from manifest.json.

Image captions is a good idea.

> [schiz0](#comment_40_153dW34Ng5fVUZ5D5NcZRfAbvRQS1jYC1k): I think it as a text (unlimited) at the bottom

It will not be visible in fullscreen, but I could add an optional alt text field as well.

> [schiz0](#comment_43_153dW34Ng5fVUZ5D5NcZRfAbvRQS1jYC1k): If I create a porn (soft, don't worry) gallery how need I set R18, yes or no? (I'm sorry, but I dont't understand :) )

On the metadata tab in the gallery editor you should see "Type: (e.g. Manga) R18: (No)" Pressing the "No" will set it to "Yes". I might change this to two radial buttons for clarity in the future.

Soft, hard, I don't care. If sex or sexualized nudity is shown explicitly and frequently for the purposes of porn in the gallery, mark it as R18. If it is eg. a background element in an otherwise narrative story, don't bother setting it to R18.

> [schiz0](#comment_44_153dW34Ng5fVUZ5D5NcZRfAbvRQS1jYC1k): 0-Gallery don't works, it stops on "Processing filter..."

Strange, try reloading the page. I know this happens when you first visit a merger (because there is no db yet I presume), but you should probably be using 1+Gallery instead of 0-Gallery. Another problem you may be encountering is that your query yielded no results, unfortunately there's a bug right now where it will still jump back "processing filter" after showing "no results" for a fraction of a second. I should probably fix that.

> [schiz0](#comment_45_153dW34Ng5fVUZ5D5NcZRfAbvRQS1jYC1k): how can I sort galleries on my hub?

not possible right now, I'll add it to the roadmap on git center

1543189245_1GDcCK6cWoj98mg541Yj9rW1nwXcB.body:
> [nofish](#comment_1219_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): It could be possible as by default it allows 10% of your free disk space for optional files. I created an issue for it on github: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1788

I'm glad to hear this, as not knowing why they got deleted would be much worse! Thank you for creating a github issue, I don't (and won't) use github so I couldn't have done it myself. What settings can stop a specific site's images from getting cleaned right now?

> [nofish](#comment_1220_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): You can go to Files section in ZeroHello, Click on Used: ..., > Edit optional files limit > Enter 10GB (or anything big) > SET

looks like that was indeed the problem, thank you!

1543247109_14mSHL2TBcqcLNcfpmg5jyGVS9RZi.body: Nice! We really needed something like this.

> [saturion](#comment_2_1Q1jvHD9GzJskrk2PuWLbudrdFLDT2nvGg): Agree, most of them don't even bother to watch youtube videos with 60% ads and 40% content, or refuse to pay a buck for a mobile game on their 1000$+ handsets. Instead they live with clickbaits and low-response ad placements in free to play and freemium clicker games.

Sadly I think you're right. TOR, ZeroNet, I2p etc. can expect an influx, but it will be relatively small. People will start using it as a VPN to view specific websites blocked in the EU, but use normal internet for everything else. Use will rise, but the communities won't see much influx.

> [vorticalbox](#comment_7_13Dnn8CFKa8NJLf4gxnJTp8sXqYqrA9U7L): Sorry about spam it was telling me it failed to post.

With ZeroNet even a "failed post" is actually posted. It just hasn't been successfully transmitted to peers yet, but once your connection to peers is restored the "failed post" will still be spread to everyone else!

1544937960_1JcHMiQxXHX9q3ZK2LF9rZjvg3MUt.body:
> [styromaniac](#comment_335_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): It's not something I'd want ZeroNet to be known for. That makes it a target for Hollywood to squander.

Hollywood is going to slander it no matter what. They aren't big fans of freedom of thought or speech. Original, quality content would be better though, just because you wouldn't be able to find the same thing on the normal web so there's more of a reason to come here.

I'm personally not a big fan of such, but sites in the vain of **Creepypasta, SCP Foundation, Rule34, any number of fanfiction sites, etc.** would probably benefit ZeroNet a lot. Not only that: a lot of people are being kicked out of such communities for not toeing the line on progressive politics, which means there's a group of disgruntled rejects who may wish to find/start a similar community in a liberated sphere of the internet.

A really big boon could also be **fanlations of manga**, if such a group decided to use and promote a hub with their translations on ZeroNet (e.g. as a backup in case their clearnet gets taken down) they would advertise their backup hub, and by extension ZeroNet itself, to their audience. This is a valuable path to growing our network.

**The number one potential driving force will always be censorship**, and on that matter things are "looking in our favor" ... looking at the silver lining and all that shit.

> [quantumworld](#comment_72_1AdWXZdPUimpXoGNXUBde2CHR7gLf4onxE): Content is King! When Zeronet gets people that have large numbers on the clear web and they post on zeronet.  Like Zeronet may be perfect for News sites. You know the ones that get taken off the web because they broke a News story that got the Gov all upset!  Snowden like  news. Things like this will draw massive traffic to zeronet. But this is just one angle. Marketing zeronet on clearnet is a key component.

That's a really good point. __**Wikileaks, Veritas, etc.**__ would benefit from using p2p serving and would draw a large audience.

Marketing networks like this is a difficult task by nature because a lot of people end up here because they left or got kicked out elsewhere.

1554657289_1KAfaybmXBh916cDwXjd4gaE7Scnw.body:
Hey @dracks:
I've pushed an update to [1+Gallery](/1PGaLLNiadMzrmw6MMMnpZnskwFcdgZoS4/) On the Hubs tab you should be able to click a button to create a new hub. It's possible you first need to download the Demo Hub (just click the first recommended hub on the same page).
If there's a specific feature you'd like to see added feel free to ask!

Make sure to add your hub to [Important Zites (new)](/1MiS3ud9JogSQpd1QVmM6ETHRmk5RgJn6E/), it's by far the best one for this type of stuff because you can add your hub to a merger category so people looking for galleryhubs can find it easily. You can also mark it as SFW or NSFW over there.

Another thing you could do is get InnocentChild to add it to his zite [InnocentChild's Room](/1J1epG5eMc4bsmh69UctBg4PHEe5B3kYHY/hubs.html) Not sure where to best contact him.

I've been thinking about creating a ZeroGallery hub where anyone can add galleries, but I'm worried it'll end up like LSTN, with a lot of unseeded galleries. When people make their own hubs they're more invested and keep the content seeded and people are more likely to reseed their whole site if they have consistent quality.

I've found where the error occurred and was able to reproduce it. Apparently a shorthand I've used is browser specific. It's a really silly error that shouldn't have happened. I've signed an update to GalleryHubPlus, I recommend everyone with a gallery to upgrade their hub to the latest version.

While testing I've noticed another error on Chromium, the gallery list is not sorted by date. No idea why that would be.

> [dracks](#comment_18_1KAfaybmXBh916cDwXjd4gaE7ScnwfiYcR): @1pgallery we need to do something to upgrade hub ?

Yes, I can't change the code on your site so when I push a new update to my hub yours does not change. You can however upgrade to the latest version by searching your hub on ZeroHello, clicking the three dots and selecting "Upgrade Code" from the menu that pops up.

> [dracks](#comment_19_1KAfaybmXBh916cDwXjd4gaE7ScnwfiYcR): @1pgallery ok thx =) for my other question about ZeroMe hub its possible ?

Hubs have a Merger type.
A `ZeroGallery` hub is for 1+Gallery, 0-gallery and other aggregation zite someone makes here. `ZeroMe` hubs are used for ZeroMe, Sakana and possibly others.

A Merger is a site that aggregates data from hubs of a certain Merger type, or multiple. Other examples are Millchan Engine (`Millchan`), Git Center (`GitCenter`), KxoVid, ZeroLSTN etc.
Right now there is no Merger zite that combines ZeroMe and ZeroGallery, but someone could make one.

you missed an f in that link [FurryHubs](/1EYrmjvLrmAzkczAhBp76trvdfuR2WXK9f/)

also, did you sign the galleries + list? It's the blue buttons on the hub page.

> [dracks](#comment_22_1KAfaybmXBh916cDwXjd4gaE7ScnwfiYcR): @1pgallery oh thx for the link and yes i do this did you sign the galleries + list? It's the blue buttons on the hub page.
`galleries/content.json` isn't signed for some reason or at least I'm not receiving it

EDIT: nevermind it's my fault, fixed it
You'll have to Upgrade the hub again and delete the `signed.json` file in `/galleries/` and then sign everything again.
The galleries json file was wrongly named in the default folder so it didn't get cloned over.

Check is the file `/galleries/content.json` now there?
if it still isn't just create it and paste this, then sign it.
```
{
 "address": "",
 "files": {},
 "ignore": ".*",
 "includes": {}
}
```
> [dracks](#comment_24_1KAfaybmXBh916cDwXjd4gaE7ScnwfiYcR): /galleries/ and /galleries/*/ ?

not sure what you mean

> [dracks](#comment_25_1KAfaybmXBh916cDwXjd4gaE7ScnwfiYcR): need to click on : Sign & Publish List The gallery list should be signe... ?

Everything should be signed. `/content.json` is for the zite itself. `/galleries/content.json` is the list of galleries and each gallery has to be signed individually (but there's a button to sign them all in one go).

I now have galleries/content.json so that part is solved. But not the galleries themselves, if you reset signed.json to `{}` the hub will know everything has to be signed again and the blue color indications will work again.
I still don't have your galleries, so I can't check. I'm going to clone it to see if I missed anything. Sorry for the trouble.

> [dracks](#comment_28_1KAfaybmXBh916cDwXjd4gaE7ScnwfiYcR): Reply

The good news is that I found the problem, the bad news is it could take a while. So best to check back tomorrow. Apparently changes I made to the signing process broke it only for first-time signing (so no one noticed until now).

I think I've fixed it. At least on my end I was able to clone the zite, create a gallery and publish it.

It's probably best to delete everything from the zite except the galleries themselves, then upgrade. That way you start completely fresh but still keep your galleries.

> [dracks](#comment_31_1KAfaybmXBh916cDwXjd4gaE7ScnwfiYcR): @1pgallery  Great that work on 1+ but not directly when we go on zite

Great! Nice to finally see it working, again excuses for the bug. I must've introduced it in the past couple of months, glad it was someone willing to keep trying who found it.

About it not working on zite is because I disabled it, I was going to add a setting to show galleries to guests or not but didn't get to implement it yet. The reason for this was that Alotofplot took really long to load any time I accidentally clicked on it (it had to inefficiently load nearly 2k galleries from individual text files, 1+gallery uses an sql database which is much faster to load that many). I'm at work atm so I can't work on it rn, but I will look into doing two important features when I get home:
1) efficient guest view for hub,
2) prompt visitors to download your galleryhub when they click link to gallery from it.
Right now you need to give people both link to your hub and link to the gallery you want to share on 1+G or 0-g, which is a bit of a hassle (sharing 2 links for 1 gallery)

EDIT: I'm also going to add a setting for collapsed/expanded on hover so people can choose whether galleries are always collapsed, always expanded or change on hover. I know people think it's annoying how I did it, but I like how compact it is so I will give people option to choose.

> [dracks](#comment_32_1KAfaybmXBh916cDwXjd4gaE7ScnwfiYcR): @1pgallerythe zite is really cool, again thanks for the help. I can not wait to see the new features =) [...]

I'm not sure, I only see it once on my end, but the comment I left myself I do see double, so it's definitely something I should look into.

> [dracks](#comment_34_1KAfaybmXBh916cDwXjd4gaE7ScnwfiYcR): @1pgallery How can I see if my gallery is accessible to others? [...]

It's definitely accessible. In the future you could try visiting through a public proxy to see if things load. It can take a while to sync, so make yourself a coffee.
What do you mean by 'publish myself'. The yellow sign & publish button was added to ZeroNet later and it actually does the same as the bottom "sign list" button. But yes, people will only get the new version when it is signed.

1555406623_13oRBYqNeUr6Tvgt4KkAT9FT4XRiK.body: Why not go a step further and look at all files downloaded with ZeroNet for hash collisions? Someone said they were working on something like this a while back.

> [itcouldbebetter](#comment_6_1Bq5MFcXziGbE4maPUuDBWZ4LRcmDnYqfK): [...] I've downloaded over 3000 sites and checked for duplicates.

What were the results? I'm curious.

Great, when we have that feature we can develop upload zites for multiple at the same time. Let's call our imaginary zite VidAll: you upload a video, add a title and description and other fields. When you click OK it gets added to KopyKate, (our) YouTube, KxoVid, etc. at the same time. That's only possible on the condition that files from one zite can be seeded to peers from other zites. Viewers can then choose their favorite front-end. This fights back against the monopoly of users/content that the clearnet sees.

PS. 20% were duplicates, but that is probably in part because people refrained from uploading the same file to multiple zites.

1555521255_1ME9gwj9Exp9cBbuSxxr1mEiySEjm.body:
My recommendation is:
Don't upload them as CBZ, instead make a ZeroGallery hub (either using the old 0-gallery hub or my newer version [1+Gallery](/1PGaLLNiadMzrmw6MMMnpZnskwFcdgZoS4/) there is a button on hub page to create a new one) and upload the images there.
Advantages:
- Can preview the comic before downloading
- Add information to the comic like tags and artist etc. and people can search using that
- People don't have to download the full zip to view images (if yours are under 10MB that's really not important though, but very useful when it's 500MB)

I'll be adding a way to download the galleries/mangas/comics as zips in the future. Millchan (/Engine) already allows downloading zipped images from a post, so it's definitely possible to do on ZeroNet.
